text.p: Finnish cargo handling equipment and building materials group Partek Oy Ab said in a statement on Wednesday its board would propose to the annual general meeting that a redemption clause be included in its articles of association.

"According to the proposal, a company shareholder whose holding in all the company shares or votes produced by the shares reaches or exceeds 33-1/3 (percent) or 50 percent will be obliged to make a redemption offer to the other company shareholders," Partek said.
The redemption price would be the highest of the following:
-- the average price weighted by the turnover of trading prices of the share during the previous 10 stock exchange days,
-- or the average price weighted by the turnover of trading prices of the previous 12 months on the Helsinki Stock Exchange,

-- or the average price, weighted by the number of shares, at which the shareholder obliged to offer the redemption has acquired shares during the previous 12 months, it said. --Helsinki newsroom +358-9-680 50 245, e-mail news@reuters.fi
